<!-- See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Indian cities]] for details -->{{Infobox Indian Jurisdiction | native_name = Shakti Nagar | type = Town| latd = 24.19| longd = 82.88| locator_position = left | state_name = Uttar Pradesh | district = [[Sonebhadra district|Sonebhadra]] | leader_title = | leader_name = | altitude = | population_as_of = 2001 | population_total = 18983| population_density = | area_magnitude= sq. km | area_total = | area_telephone = 05446 | postal_code = | vehicle_code_range = | sex_ratio = | unlocode = | website = | footnotes = | }} '''Shaktinagar''' is a small town in [[Sonbhadra]], [[Mirzapur Division]], [[Uttar Pradesh]] near [[Varanasi]], [[India]]. NTPC plant of 2000MW thermal energy generation capacity. The NTPC's PLF (plant load factor) is high at around 98% and it is the mother plant of NTPC all over [[India]]. It was established in 1975 and started its operations in 1980 with 7 units operating (200MW * 5 and 500MW * 2). The source of water it uses is the [[Rihand Dam]] and the source of coal is the NCL mines around Shaktinagar like Jayant, Duddhichua, Nigahi, Kakri, Khadia and Bina.The coal supplies from NCL has made it possible to produce about 10515 MW of electricity from pithead power plants of National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC), Uttar Pradesh Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd (UPRVUNL) and Renupower division of M/s. Hindalco Industries. The region is now called the "power capital of India". The ultimate capacity of power generation of these power plants is 13295 MW and NCL is fully prepared to meet the increased demand of coal for the purpose. In addition, NCL supplies coal to power plants of Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd, Delhi Vidyut Board (DVB) and Hariyana State Electricity Board.
==About== Some of the famous places in the town are Chilka Lake Park, Helipad, Jwala Mukhi Mandir, Shiv Mandir, Sunday Market(for vegetables), Sangam Shopping Center and the Jawahar Lal Nehru Stadium. The town is also well connected with road services from Varanasi(208 KM ). Nearest Railway stations are Shaktinagar(3 KM), Singrauli(20 KM) and Anpara(25 KM),krishnashila(13 km). It also have State Bank of India which is the best branch in this region and offers all the products to the customers of this region.
For dining you can opt for Indian Coffee House(above SBI), Upvan, Panchwati, Shakti Restaurant, Moti Dhabha.
Places to visit nearby are Vendam fall(110 km), Gopat, Manda stream, Manda caves(60 km), vindhyanagar park, st. joseph padri school, shopping center etc.
==Industries== Nearby industries HINDALCO(ADITYA BIRLA GROUP) NORTHERN COAL FIELDS LTD which provides coal to ntpc plant to generate electricity and supply to delhi.
==Education== Schools in the town include St. Joseph School, which was established in 1974, a DAV Public School,Vivekanand Vidhyalaya, Lions School, Kendra Vidhyalaya<ref>[http://www.kvshaktinagar.org/index.php Kendra Vidhyalaya]</ref>, and GIC. Suryodaya(1973) one of the oldest shop in town, helps school, colleges(Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapeeth) and other educational institutes with the educational elements/materials so they can perform better in the competitive world.
